entries.meaning: (informal) A person who makes a fuss, particularly about trivial things.
examples: My teacher is such a fusspot, he marks us down for handwriting!

verbs.description: fusspot (third-person singular simple present fusspots, present participle fusspotting, simple past and past participle fusspotted)

entries.meaning: (informal, intransitive) To make a fuss, particularly about trivial things.
examples: I hadn't realised then that fusspotting about small details of social disorder was an Australian obsession.
